metadata.Title: CVE-2009-4924 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Dan Pascu python-cjson 1.0.5 does not properly handle a ['/'] argument to cjson.encode, which makes it easier for remote attackers to conduct certain cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks involving Firefox and the end tag of a SCRIPT element.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2009-4924` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-cjson - 1.0.5-4build1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-cjson package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.5-4build1').
